#2

These are called choose-your-own-adventure books/novels.

Hypertext refers to clickable links. This would be an electronic book, not a paper one.

#4

There appears to be no agreed name for this genre. So far, I have found

hypertext, -> not understood by the majority,

interactive fiction, -> useful but vague,

non-sequential writing, -> technical, higher register,

multiple-storyline book -> somewhat simplistic but likely to be understood.

choose your own adventure -> very descriptive, somewhat long, the copyright has lapsed.

There is an interesting article at The Surprisingly Long History of 'Choose-Your-Own-Adventure' Stories that gives some context for some of those terms.
